## Motivation

The purpose of this assignment is to ensure that everyone 
gains hands-on practice creating software packages in R. 
This assignment also contains an optional added challenge 
to gain hands-on practice creating software packages in Python as well. 
If students complete the optional challenge, they get a 10% bonus mark on this assignment (so the highest possible mark is 110%).

### Submission instructions

In the textbox provided for this assignment on Canvas,
you must submit: 

1. A link to the GitHub.com repository containing the R package 
that you create for this assignment.

2. (optional) A note stating that you did the optional/bonus component, 
and if so, a link to the GitHub.com repository containing the Python package 
that you created for the optional/bonus component of this assigment.

### Exercise instructions - Create an R Package (required)

Read through, 
and follow all of the promts in 
[The whole game](https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html) 
chapter of the R Packages book.
At the end of this chapter, you will have created a toy R package
that lives inside a public repository on GitHub.com.

### Exercise instructions - Create a Python Package (optional/bonus)

Read through, 
and follow all of the promts in the
[How to package a Python](https://py-pkgs.org/03-how-to-package-a-python) 
chapter of the Python Packages book.
At the end of this chapter, you will have created a toy Python package
that lives inside a public repository on GitHub.com.

## Rubric 

This assignment will be graded for completion as follows:

|Grade | Description |
|------|-------------|
| 110% | A working toy R package, and a working toy Python package was created as described in the [The whole game](https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html) chapter of the R Packages book, and the [How to package a Python](https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html) chapter of the Python Packages book, respectively. |
| 100% | A working toy R package was created as described in the [The whole game](https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html) chapter of the R Packages book.  |
| 75%  | A toy R package was created as described in the [The whole game](https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html) chapter of the R Packages book however there are 1-2 aspects missing, or completed incorrectly, that affect the packages functionality or documentation (i.e., it does not fully work as expected). |
| 50%  | A toy R package was created as described in the [The whole game](https://r-pkgs.org/whole-game.html) chapter of the R Packages book however there are 3 or more aspects missing, or completed incorrectly, that affect the packages functionality or documentation (i.e., it does not fully work as expected).  |
| 0%   | The assignment was not attempted. |
